have be lay down by mr. madison that rule be whenever a question arise concern a particular power the first question be whether the power be express in the constitution if be the question be decide if be not express the next inquiry must be whether be properly an incident to an express power and necessary to execution if be may be exercise by congress if be not congress can not exercise be not pretend that there be any express grant in the constitution confer on congress the power in question be then an incidental power necessary and proper for the execution of any of the grant power all the grant power be confidently affirm may be effectually execute without the aid of such an incident a power to be incidental must not be exercise for end which make a principal or substantive power independent of the principal power to which be an incident be not enough that may be regard by congress as convenient or that exercise would advance the public weal must be necessary and proper to the execution of the principal express power to which be an incident and without which such principal power can not be carry into effect the whole frame of the|federal|constitution prove that the government which create be intend to be of limited and specify power a construction of the constitution so broad as that by which the power in question be defend tend imperceptibly to a consolidation republican system of the|united|state into a monarchy to guard against the assumption of all power which encroach upon the reserve sovereignty of the states and which consequently tend to subject experience have demonstrate the wisdom of the rule that all the functionary of the|federal|government should abstain from the exercise of all questionable or doubtful power if an enlargement mercantile and mechanical operation the apprehension may be well entertain that without something to ameliorate the rigor of cash payment the entire import trade may fall into the hand of a few wealthy capitalist in this country and in europe the small importer who require all the money can raise for investment abroad and who can but ill afford to pay the low duty would have to subduct in advance a portion of fund in order to pay the duty and would lose the interest upon the amount thus pay for all the time the good may remain unsold which may absorb profit the rich capitalist abroad as well as at home would thus possess after a short time an almost exclusive monopoly of the import trade and law design for the benefit of all would thus operate for the benefit of a few a result wholly uncongenial with the spirit of institution and antirepublican in all tendency the warehouse system would enable the importer to watch the market and to select own time for offer good for sale a always be improbable that an intelligent and virtuous community can consent to raise a surplus for the mere purpose of divide diminish as must inevitably be by the expense of the various machinery necessary to the process the safe and simplest mode of obviate all the difficulty which have be mention be to collect only revenue enough to meet the want of the government and let the people keep the balance of property in own hand to be use for own profit each state will then support own government and contribute due share toward the support of the general government there would be no surplus to cramp and lessen the resource of individual wealth and enterprise and the bank would be leave to ordinary mean whatever agitation and fluctuation may arise from unfortunate paper system could never be attribute justly or unjustly to the action of the federal government there would be some guaranty that the spirit of wild speculation which seek to convert the surplus revenue into banking capital would be effectually check and that the scene of demoralization which be now so prevalent through the land would disappear without desire to conceal that the experience and observation of within the state tend to invest in the hand and place under the control of the general government all the principal road and canal of the country in violation of state right and in derogation of state from the experience of the evil of the issue of paper during the revolution have become so justly obnoxious as not only to suggest the clause in the constitution forbid the emission of bill of credit variableness must ever be the characteristic of a currency of which the precious metal be not the chief ingredient or which can be expand or contract without regard to the principle that regulate the
